title: Criterion 1
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately describes Polykleitos’ ideas about sculpting the human form.
descriptions: Accurately describes Polykleitos’ ideas about sculpting the human form.

title: Criterion 2
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately uses specific visual evidence to explain how those ideas shaped the creation of the original Doryphoros.
descriptions: Accurately uses specific visual evidence to explain how those ideas shaped the creation of the original Doryphoros.

title: Criterion 3
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Accurately uses Polykleitos’ ideas from his treatise to explain how those ideas shaped the creation of the original Doryphoros.
descriptions: Accurately uses Polykleitos’ ideas from his treatise to explain how those ideas shaped the creation of the original Doryphoros.

title: Criterion 4
stimulusHtml:
0-2 points

Accurately analyzes why Polykleitos’ ideas, as expressed in the Doryphoros, were so influential in ancient Greece.

The first point is earned for accurately explaining why Polykleitos’ ideas were so influential in ancient Greece.

The second point is earned for analysis, for accurately explaining the relationship between the Doryphoros and why Polykleitos’ ideas were so influential in ancient Greece.
descriptions:
Accurately analyzes why Polykleitos’ ideas, as expressed in the Doryphoros, were so influential in ancient Greece.

The first point is earned for accurately explaining why Polykleitos’ ideas were so influential in ancient Greece.

The second point is earned for analysis, for accurately explaining the relationship between the Doryphoros and why Polykleitos’ ideas were so influential in ancient Greece.
